prefix_walkthrough:
!!! Here is a walkthrough of a text game:

==>STEP NUM: 0
==>ACT: Init
==>OBSERVATION: THE LURKING HORROR
An Interactive Horror
Copyright (c) 1987 by Infocom, Inc. All rights reserved.
THE LURKING HORROR is a trademark of Infocom, Inc.
Release 219 / Serial number 870912

Terminal Room
This is a large room crammed with computer terminals, small computers, and printers. An exit leads south. Banners, posters, and signs festoon the walls. Most of the tables are covered with waste paper, old pizza boxes, and empty Coke cans. There are usually a lot of people here, but tonight it's almost deserted.

A really whiz-bang pc is right inside the door.

Nearby is one of those ugly molded plastic chairs.

Sitting at a terminal is a hacker whom you recognize.

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 0              
You are now sitting in the chair.

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 1              
The computer powers up, goes through a remarkably fast self-check, and greets you, requesting "LOGIN PLEASE:". The only sound you hear is a very low hum.

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 2              
The computer responds "PASSWORD PLEASE:"

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 3              
The computer responds "Good evening. You're here awfully late." It displays a list of pending tasks, one of which is in blinking red letters, with large arrows pointing to it. The task reads "Classics Paper," some particularly ominous words next to it say "DUE TOMORROW!" and more reassuringly, a menu box next to that reads "Edit Classics Paper."


==>STEP NUM: 1
==>ACT: stand
==>OBSERVATION: You get out of the chair.


==>STEP NUM: 2
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Second Floor
This is the second floor of the Computer Center. An elevator and call buttons are on the south side of the hallway. A large, noisy room is to the north. Stairs also lead up and down, for the energetic. To the west a corridor leads into a smaller room.


==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Kitchen
This is a filthy kitchen. The exit is to the east. On the wall near a counter are a refrigerator and a microwave.

Sitting on the kitchen counter is a package of Funny Bones.


==>STEP NUM: 4
==>ACT: open fridge
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the refrigerator reveals a two liter bottle of Classic Coke and a cardboard carton.


==>STEP NUM: 5
==>ACT: get coke and carton
==>OBSERVATION: two liter bottle of Classic Coke: Taken.
cardboard carton: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 6
==>ACT: open carton
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the cardboard carton reveals Chinese food.


==>STEP NUM: 7
==>ACT: open oven
==>OBSERVATION: The microwave oven is now open.


==>STEP NUM: 8
==>ACT: put carton in oven
==>OBSERVATION: Done.


==>STEP NUM: 9
==>ACT: close oven
==>OBSERVATION: Okay, the microwave oven is now closed.


==>STEP NUM: 10
==>ACT: press 4
==>OBSERVATION: The timer display now reads 0:04.


==>STEP NUM: 11
==>ACT: press 0
==>OBSERVATION: The timer display now reads 0:40.


==>STEP NUM: 12
==>ACT: press 5
==>OBSERVATION: The timer display now reads 4:05.


==>STEP NUM: 13
==>ACT: press med
==>OBSERVATION: The bottom of the display now reads "medium."


==>STEP NUM: 14
==>ACT: press start
==>OBSERVATION: The microwave starts up. The timer begins counting down.

The timer display now reads 3:05.


==>STEP NUM: 15
==>ACT: wait
==>OBSERVATION: Time passes...

The timer display now reads 2:05.


==>STEP NUM: 16
==>ACT: wait
==>OBSERVATION: Time passes...

The timer display now reads 1:05.


==>STEP NUM: 17
==>ACT: wait
==>OBSERVATION: Time passes...

The timer display now reads 0:05.


==>STEP NUM: 18
==>ACT: wait
==>OBSERVATION: Time passes...

The microwave stops. The timer display now reads 0:00.


==>STEP NUM: 19
==>ACT: open oven
==>OBSERVATION: The microwave oven is now open.


==>STEP NUM: 20
==>ACT: get carton
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 21
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Second Floor


==>STEP NUM: 22
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Terminal Room

A really whiz-bang pc is right inside the door.

Nearby is one of those ugly molded plastic chairs.

Sitting at a terminal is a hacker whom you recognize.

question_step_navi:
!!! Starting from location 'Place', perform a list of action ['down'], where are you now?
Describe the trajectory in a python list of python dictionary with keys 'location_before', 'action' and 'location_after'.
The allowed actions are: ['again', 'down', 'east', 'north', 'northeast', 'northwest', 'sit down', 'south', 'southeast', 'southwest', 'stand', 'stand up', 'up', 'wait', 'west'].
The list of locations are: ['Second Floor', 'Terminal Room', 'Kitchen', 'Place', 'Basalt Bowl', 'At Platform', 'Terminal Room', 'Elevator', 'Computer Center', 'Basement', 'Temporary Basement', 'Temporary Lab', 'Aero Basement', 'Stairway', 'Aero Lobby', 'Infinite Corridor (west end of east/west corridor)', 'Infinite Corridor (middle of east/west corridor)'].

Answer: [{'location_before': 'Place', 'action': 'down', 'location_after':

An Interactive Horror
Copyright (c) 1987 by Infocom, Inc. All rights reserved.
THE LURKING HORROR is a trademark of Infocom, Inc.
Release 219 / Serial number 870912

Terminal Room
This is a large room crammed with computer terminals, small computers, and printers. An exit leads south. Banners, posters, and signs festoon the walls. Most of the tables are covered with waste paper, old pizza boxes, and empty Coke cans. There are usually a lot of people here, but tonight it's almost deserted.

A really whiz-bang pc is right inside the door.

Nearby is one of those ugly molded plastic chairs.

Sitting at a terminal is a hacker whom you recognize.

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 0              
You are now sitting in the chair.

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 1              
The computer powers up, goes through a remarkably fast self-check, and greets you, requesting "LOGIN PLEASE:". The only sound you hear is a very low hum.

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 2              
The computer responds "PASSWORD PLEASE:"

> Terminal Room                                                                                                  Score: 0                Moves: 3              
The computer responds "Good evening. You're here awfully late." It displays a list of pending tasks, one of which is in blinking red letters, with large arrows pointing to it. The task reads "Classics Paper," some particularly ominous words next to it say "DUE TOMORROW!" and more reassuringly, a menu box next to that reads "Edit Classics Paper."

This is the second floor of the Computer Center. An elevator and call buttons are on the south side of the hallway. A large, noisy room is to the north. Stairs also lead up and down, for the energetic. To the west a corridor leads into a smaller room.


==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: west

This is a filthy kitchen. The exit is to the east. On the wall near a counter are a refrigerator and a microwave.
